website_summaries.verdict: Sluggish performance and a more limited feature set than similarly priced competitors hold the Canon PowerShot G5 back from being a leading contender among its peers.
pros: The Canon PowerShot G5 X has a great viewfinder and a comfortable shooting design for serious photographers
cons: It can be frustratingly slow, with a short battery life

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera, being a professional photographer, sometime I am not able to bring my professional DSLR with me but this camera fill in the gaps on that. I highly recommend it. Please remember this is not a dslr.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: The swivel screen was perfect for the occasional selfie
customer_reviews.text: I have two high end Canon DSLRs with a host of lenses but took this with me to Italy. It fit in my purse and took fabulous photos. I chose it because I could use the view finder instead of the outer screen when I needed to see composition in sunlight. The swivel screen was perfect for the occasional selfie. All in all it is one of the best purchases I've made. Bigger isn't always better.
customer_reviews.author: PJM

customer_reviews.title: mini dslr
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for what i need so i dont have to carry my canon 5d/ii on vacation or traveling. It takes great quality, crisp photos and I really love the look of the camera itself. Just like a mini dslr.
customer_reviews.author: ilovegooddeals

customer_reviews.title: Having a little buyer's remorse.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. I should have looked at reviews from multiple sources which call the software slow and buggy (true) andlens quality so, so. For those considering this, there is a new model that is said to be greatly improved an puts it on par with the better Sony RX100 models. I was excited to have the eyepiece viewfinder, but realized atf it takes the camera a bit too far out of the "pocket" category. The new model is pricier, but has a retractable eyepiece, a better sensor 4k video and solid software. Yes, the camera does reasonably well but I was hoping for something more.
customer_reviews.author: B. Reimer

customer_reviews.title: Stills only - lacks sharpness - pop
customer_reviews.text: Its good camera, however no sharpness. All the pictures look dull and must be post processed. Google Photos POP is must tool. Once processed, pics looks great. Got wonderful DOF effects similar to DSLR. All the nice advance controls. If you are serious photographer, you will love the EC+/- ring. Being a serious DSLR user, I loved not carrying heavy stuff while on family vacation. This small handy camera did fantastic job.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewsRock

customer_reviews.title: Buy It New Before It Gets Discontinued :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought it just because of the design itself but unfortunately it's getting phased out for the G5X Mark 2. The design build and functions of the camera is AMAZING. It will not disappoint! I also felt the same way with the Canon Creators Kit that has the T71 Rebel, a boom mic, memory card and that is slowly phasing out too :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality is so good! A little disappointed that it didn't come with ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality is so good! A little disappointed that it didn't come with a cord to upload videos as I use this for vlogging and it took me a second to figure how to upload videos but it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Great all rounder
customer_reviews.text: Stunning product, we use seven now across Manchester Confidential and find them perfect for food photography as well asvgeneralbreporting
customer_reviews.author: Mark R Garner

customer_reviews.title: It's a really good camera. The manual settings are the same as ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a really good camera. The manual settings are the same as a advanced camera. I really like the quality of the pictures too. Only problem was there was a dust particle on the inside of the lens, but it is covered by the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: cp

customer_reviews.title: Best Small Camera for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I took this camera to Patagonia because I didn't want to carry a long lens camera. The Canon PowerShot G5 has all the settings that one would one. Once the pics are downloaded adjustments can be made to the pics.
customer_reviews.author: Chasmirus

customer_reviews.title: Such a sweet camera
customer_reviews.text: I love canon cameras. I really love this camera. Yes, it doesn't have all the bells and whistles of the Sony RX100 but this camera produces some great pictures and has great auto focusing capabilities. It's also solid metal body camera. Things that made it stand out for me other than image quality were the view finder (sometime you need hold the camera to your head to frame the shot), the multi-directional screen, and the AF. I forgot the touch screen is amazing and so is the ability to adjust camera settings on the fly. Such a sweet camera. Get it.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia HayesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Your going to love your pictures...
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful camera, a must have for almost any situation. A compact camera that can do it all. I recommend it. It makes high resolution sharp focused detail pictures.
customer_reviews.author: RPG and GST

customer_reviews.title: This camera is awesome! The seller is great
customer_reviews.text: This camera is awesome! The seller is great. I had a few questions prior to purchase and they answered everything. This is my pocket camera and the photos are amazing as is the video. A++
customer_reviews.author: Nina Kruse

customer_reviews.title: A great almost dSLR camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fully automatic or fully manual. It's a great step up from a point and shoot without having to go with a dSLR. The electronic viewfinder is very accurate and has the full display notifications. I rarely use the screen while taking photos. The screen is large and it's a touch-screen, which makes it easy and intuitive to use. There's a focal length setting, which is like having extra lenses without having to lug them around. This is a great camera if you're ready to take full control of your photos and don't want to pay a premium for a dSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera. But as is the trend, the battery is small and drains quickly when using video.
customer_reviews.author: Hondo

customer_reviews.title: the perfect camera to take when traveling and not be loaded ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality camera, the perfect camera to take when traveling and not be loaded down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1 inch sensor, 20 mp
customer_reviews.text: Zoom could be could be greater (maybe 10x), however, camera is great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Willie E.

customer_reviews.title: Good working camera
customer_reviews.text: Good working camera, picture quality and ease of use. Love the selfie screen!! Great for video/youtube. Autofocus works great. Big downside is battery life, consider expense of getting aftermarket batteries when deciding on this purchase. But definitely not as big as micro 4/3 camera, put not a full-pocketable camera. Quality makes up for the size, and battery-life.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel Co

customer_reviews.title: I think the photo quality is fine. It is definitely not comparable to DSLR quality
customer_reviews.text: I think the photo quality is fine. It is definitely not comparable to DSLR quality. I however love the video quality and the selfie mode (wayyyy better than most smart phones). Great point and shoot camera for traveling too.
customer_reviews.author: lilninja

customer_reviews.title: very good work. I wish there was a way to ...
customer_reviews.text: Camera does very, very good work. I wish there was a way to add a polarizing filter.
customer_reviews.author: G. Heumann

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice small camera but you need to have an extra battery for recharging.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Leib

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves this camera, Great pictures...small enough to always take it with her...
customer_reviews.author: Ken Hill

customer_reviews.title: Too many buttons
customer_reviews.text: Canon g5x takes good enough pictures. I usually like the layout of my canon cameras. But not this one. For a small camera, Canon packed in too many features in g5x. For me, some of them are either not useful or too difficult to use. I find it difficult to hold the camera steady and also easy to accidentally hit some unintended button in operation. Maybe g1x is a better camera for me.
customer_reviews.author: Alchemist

customer_reviews.title: Canon got it right this time....
customer_reviews.text: Just got my G5X today and have taken several pictures using different methods. Canon got it right this time. It is great.....
customer_reviews.author: atpguy

customer_reviews.title: Canon G5X -- I really like this camera
customer_reviews.text: Canon G5X -- I really like this camera. Occasionally in certain lighting I'm getting some annoying lens reflection artifacts, but overall this camera is working very well for me. Good low light photos with higher ASA. Good size. Good feature set & controls.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall F. Smith

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot G5 X Digital Camera w/ 1 Inch Sensor and Built-in viewfinder - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
product_meta.description: Style:Camera OnlyThe first PowerShot G-Series camera to incorporate a full-featured 2.36 million dot electronic viewfinder, the amazing Canon PowerShot G5 X Camera makes it simple to compose, set and capture high-quality stills and video without taking your eye away from the camera. For photography in the glare of bright sunlight, recording HD Video in an auditorium and other situations where the lighting is difficult or using the LCD monitor is inconvenient, the PowerShot G5 X’s electronic viewfinder helps enable unfettered operation. Full control is made simple with dedicated dials situated around the camera that let you easily customize and control the settings. What’s more, helpful features like a built-in accessory hot shoe and a multi-angle, capacitive touch screen monitor serve to create an experience as unique as the subject being recorded. With its phenomenal and large imaging sensor, its marvelous electronic viewfinder and comprehensive operation, the PowerShot G5 X can deliver performance that’s easy to see.FEATURES: 1.0-inch, 20.2 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS Sensor - At the heart of the PowerShot G5 X camera is a brilliant 1.0-inch 20.2 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor. Physically larger than the sensors found in most compact cameras, the PowerShot G5 X's sensor works in tandem with Canon's DIGIC 6 Image Processor to quickly deliver gorgeous, high-resolution images with nuanced details, plus impressive low-light performance with a low signal-to-noise ratio and minimal noise and distortion. Suitable for tremendous enlargements, significant cropping and many other applications appealing to the advanced photographer, images and video captured on the PowerShot G5 X's sensor are engineered to impress even the most critical eye.Canon DIGIC 6 Image Processor - The PowerShot G5 X camera is powered by the latest iteration of Canon's proprietary processor, the DIGIC 6 Image Processor, which takes still and video image quality to a beautiful
feature_bullets: 1.0-inch, 20.2 Megapixel* High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor combined with Canon's powerful DIGIC 6 Image Processor creates the Canon HS SYSTEM for outstanding low-light performance up to ISO 12800, enhanced image quality and fast operation
Convenient controls include an exposure compensation dial, front dial, control ring and control dial that helps provide for quick customization of shooting settings
Multi-angle capacitive 3.0" touch panel LCD with a screen resolution of 1.04 million dots for a sharp, clear display and easy operation and sharing

Capture stunning 1080p Full HD video (60p/30p/24p options) for lifelike images and convenient playback on an HDTV via the HDMI output. Record at up to 60 frames per second for even more detailed, superb results in MP4 format

Easily transfer images and videos to a compatible smartphone, tablet or Canon Connect Station CS100 device with built-in Wi-Fi and NFC capability, and share on social networking sites or view on an HDTV
Includdes NB-13L Lithium-Ion Battery Pack (3.6V, 1250mAh), CB-2LH Battery Charger for NB-13L Li-Ion Batteries, NS-DC12 Neck Strap, Strap Adapter and Limited 1-Year Warranty
